title: Kasich to GOP: Avoid Shutting Down Govt Over Planned Parenthood
content:
Since President Obama won’t sign bill that includes withholding federal money from Planned Parenthood, “all we’re going to do is shut the government down” if congressional Republicans force that issue as part of funding the govt, John Kasich says at CNN Republican presidential debate. 

People will ask: “What’s the story with these Republicans,” he says 

Several other candidates disagree; “If we do not stand up and force President Obama to veto bill, shame on us,” Carly Fiorina says 

“We need to be talking about what we’re willing to shutdown for,” Chris Christie says 

Ted Cruz reiterates position that he would “stand for life” and shut down government over Planned Parenthood funding 

NOTE: Some GOP lawmakers say they won’t support any stopgap funding bill for FY16 that includes Planned Parenthood funding; Republican congressional leaders have said shutdown needs to be avoided, Planned Parenthood issue can be addressed through other measures 

Congress needs to pass bill to keep the government open past Sept. 30, end of FY15 

NOTE: CNN hosting debate featuring top 11 candidates in GOP race, as determined by recent natl polling, at Ronald Reagan Presidential Library in Simi Valley, Calif.
